thread.section_title: This Morning made daytime TV history by having a live nose job – Metro
thread.title: This Morning made daytime TV history by having a live nose job
thread.title_full: This Morning made daytime TV history by having a live nose job

author: Adam Starkey
title: This Morning made daytime TV history by having a live nose job
text:
This Morning performed a live nose-job (Picture: ITV) Just in case you thought daytime TV lacked cosmetic surgery, This Morning made show history by having a nose job live in the studio. 
How three Emmerdale scenes proved once again this week that it's more than a soap Cosmetic surgeon Dr Ayad Harb appeared on the show to give Julie a filler top-up live on This Morning, to the shock of hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield.
Because what’s daytime television without some cosmetic surgery between the celebrity gossip and tearful interviews? Rubbish, that’s what.
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
The hosts were even unsure if they were allowed to broadcast the injection, with Holly asking: ‘Do you do it when we’re not watching?’
Before being given the thumbs up from producers, she added: ‘Are we allowed to show that?’
The surgeon got stuck in when given the green-light (Picture: ITV) Julie previously had filler injected two years ago at the cost of £500, and was more than happy to have a swift top-up on live television.
The results of the nose job were then revealed 30 minutes later, where surprisingly, there was a pretty noticeable change.
The results of the nose-job were pretty surprising (Picture: ITV) Safe to say, viewers were fascinated by the whole affair. you think im gunna watch a live nose job? you're right. #ThisMorning 
— lol ur not matty (@_emofunkrocker) March 30, 2017 
live nose job on #ThisMorning 
— TraceyJukes (@Traceywales) March 30, 2017 
This nose job is pretty interesting tbh. #ThisMorning 
— banana brain (@PaaigeJessica) March 30, 2017 
And there was some surprise by the results. Great nose job! #thismorning 
— HM (@Minihomi22) March 30, 2017 
Inevitably, there’s always one who was a little distracted. This cosmetic surgeon on This Morning is a proper bit of candy #thismorning 
— A G. (@Ar94__) March 30, 2017 

Focus, people.
If you need something a bit chirpier from your daytime TV, a man recently proposed to his girlfriend on the show to emotional reactions aplenty.
For more nose-job promos, you can catch This Morning weekdays on ITV at 10.30am.
It's a daytime first, as we bring you the lunch break nose job #ThisMorning pic.twitter.com/7PCV7l1F6p 
— This Morning (@thismorning) March 30, 2017
